utterance.speaker: WILL
utterance.content: No. No, no!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: You want to do something tonight?

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Sure. If you want.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We could, umm … go watch a movie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, if you want to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, not if you don’t want to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, if you want to I want to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? We’ve watched a lot of movies over the last couple of weeks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … maybe we could … you know, if you wanted …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I wanted to, what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, we could try something else … tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something else, as in… ?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, yeah. I mean, we haven’t … since.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, given everything that’s happened, I thought … you weren’t … ready.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought that you weren’t ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m ready. I’m – I – – I’m so ready.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’m ready, too. Like, I’m really ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Well then, what are we waiting for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You promise?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, we’ll pick up where we left off. I’ll even slip into that Valentine’s Day gift you got me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean the one with –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With the –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh. Is that a pool cue through his chest? I guess we don’t have to ask how he died.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Inferior vena cava was punctured. He bled out in minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when did it happen?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The couple in the unit downstairs heard a struggle at 7:50 and called 911. Said it sounded like a hell of a fight. Victim’s name is William Fairwick. He was 25.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what else do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Other than his taste in anarchy tattoos and satanic design, not much yet. His laptop and phone were both password protected.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Sorry. Subway took forever.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro. You’re supposed to be on call. Why do you smell like a wino?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I was at dinner with Jenny and – and someone spilled a drink on me as I rushed out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The debris from this breakage goes from left to right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So whoever did it was left handed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And most likely invited. All the doors and windows were locked from the inside and despite the wreckage there’s no sign of forced entry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was anything stolen?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, none of the obvious valuables, but I did find this stashed in the back of his sock drawer. It’s $20,000 in cash. It could be what the killer was looking for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s pretty risky, leaving it here. What did this guy do for a living?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, check it out. I found his work ID. It says here, Greenblatt Insurance. I’ll track it down, see if it has any relevance.

utterance.speaker: HENRY WRIGHT
utterance.content: Oh my God, Will? What happened?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Yeah, we’ve been neighbors for two years. Uh, we play video games after work sometimes. I was just seeing if he was around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you here all night, Henry?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So did you hear anything?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Sorry, I’ve been laying siege to the Fortress of Cobalt all night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From Terra Quest? What are you, a wily Westland ghoul? Menacing Southriver orc? Oh! East mountain goblin.

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: I’m their king, actually.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Respect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway, back to the real world. So did Will exhibit any odd behavior recently?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: No. It was pretty much the same routine. I mean, he’d go to work in the morning, come home at night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, did he talk about any of this other friends? Was he having troubles with anyone?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: We didn’t talk much about real life stuff. It was mainly just Terra Quest. But if he was having a problem it probably had something to do with how he made his money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: At Greenblatt Insurance?

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Claims adjuster, that was just his day job. He was making a fortune every night over at Chelsea Billiards. Guy was a pool hustler.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That explains the cold hard cash we found in his sock drawer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the pool cue we found in his chest.

utterance.speaker: FATS SHEPHERD
utterance.content: Yeah, Will worked my tables. He was the best I’ve ever seen. Knew all the angles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyone he took for money ever have a problem with him?

utterance.speaker: SHEPHERD
utterance.content: Sure, but Will mostly hustled Wall Street tools for ten bills a game. Losing a grand here and there, that’s chump change for them. None of those guys would ever kill Will over a bet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But there are guys that would?

utterance.speaker: SHEPHERD
utterance.content: Will always worked the upscale clubs like mine where it’s safe to take money off the clientele. But recently I heard that he started hustling out in Brooklyn. At O’Neil’s. That place is full of felons and low-lifes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea why he decided to move his game up there?

utterance.speaker: SHEPHERD
utterance.content: Well, it wasn’t for the money. I mean, he was cleaning up here. But uh … what people say and do doesn’t always make sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Shepherd –

utterance.speaker: SHEPHERD
utterance.content: No, it’s probably nothing. I mean, it’s stupid even.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not stupid if it could help us fill in the blanks on Will’s life.

utterance.speaker: SHEPHERD
utterance.content: I once asked him how he got to be so good. He told me he "went down to the crossroads and made a deal with the devil" for his talent. I figure, that’s gotta be a joke, right? But the other night, well, he looked nervous. I mean, downright scared. So I asked him, I said, what’s going on? You know what he told me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but I want to know.

utterance.speaker: SHEPHERD
utterance.content: He said it wasn’t a joke. He said his time was up. That he was about to lose his soul. Like I said though, stupid, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo’s got something for us at the precinct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A guy says he’s going to lose his soul and then he does? How creepy is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A guy was hustling felons and got himself killed. That’s not creepy, that’s probable cause. Anything on our vic’s employer?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. I got a 1-800 number for Greenblatt Insurance but they’re closed until tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you stop by O’Neil’s Bar in Brooklyn on your way home? Ask around about the vic?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … unless Jenny needs you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No. All good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, what do we got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I pulled security footage from Will’s building. There’s a security camera in the elevator area slightly angled towards Will’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: I was able to magnify the footage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Then we should be able to pull an image of our killer leaving the apartment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We should. Yeah. But … watch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is a minute before the 911 call.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: And this is minutes later.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The door opens and closes on its own. And then no one enters or exits the apartment until police arrive, and all the windows were locked from the inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s impossible. The killer had to get in and out somehow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, can you play that again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s your killer right there. Don’t you see? Will made a deal with the devil and the contract was up so it was time to pay. The devil came and got his due.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? That’s how the devil is going to kill someone? Using a broken pool stick?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, perhaps the prince of darkness is trying to make a point. You live by the cue you die by the cue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought he just usually released the hellhounds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, then how do you explain what we just saw back in there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Easy. Will didn’t close the door all the way when he came back in. Our window was open, the killer came through it, and this huge gust of wind forced the door open, then shut when they left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Esposito said all the windows were locked from the inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our killer’s a pro. He knows how to reset interior locks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except Will lives on the nineteenth floor with no fire escape.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, Castle. You know that there are plenty of ways to access windows on high level floors without a fire escape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. If you’re Spider-Man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our killer’s not Spider-Man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Agreed. Because it’s the devil.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The only place that we’re going to find the devil in this case is in the details. Once we find out more about Will’s life, then we will uncover who his earthbound enemy is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tomorrow. Tonight I have something I’d like to uncover back at home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t answer that. Don’t. Don’t even. Don’t look at it. Don’t answer it. Don’t pick it up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just hold on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You picked it up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Oh, Lanie, yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lanie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll be right there.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: On closer examination of the body I found multiple stress fractures here, on the victim’s left wrist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From what?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, they’re consistent with flexion, extension, and hyperextension as a left handed person would experience if they –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Grabbed a pool cue and smashed everything to bits. So Will’s left handed. Are you saying that Will destroyed his own apartment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Swinging a pool cue blindly to defend himself? I’m telling you, it makes perfect sense. What would you do if you were attacked by an invisible demonic force?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’d tell Ryan to lay off the bean burritos at lunch.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So you were right. Will’s troubles may have followed him home from O’Neil’s pool hall. I spoke with several witnesses that said that he got into an altercation there last week with an ex-con named Jiggy Michaels.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How serious was the altercation?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Jiggy smashed a beer bottle, threatened to kill him. Several people had to hold him back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That qualifies as serious.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Apparently Will hustled him out of twenty grand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is the exact same amount of money we found at his apartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Plus Jiggy has over a dozen priors, including multiple B and E’s. He can get in and out undetected. They call him the ghost.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. A real world killer who can get in and out undetected. Now, that makes perfect sense.

utterance.speaker: JIGGY MICHAELS
utterance.content: I want a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: This ain’t my first rodeo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm. Well then, that is too bad. Because a lawyer is going to tell you not to talk.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then how are you going to explain to a grand jury that you threatened to kill a guy who hustled you and then three days later he ended up dead?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: As a second story man for several crime bosses, you knew how to break into Fairwick’s place, but when you couldn’t find your money you settled on revenge instead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Now we’ve got a taxi receipt dropping you off in Chelsea last night, three blocks from Will’s apartment. That’s a long way from your place in Cypress Hills, Jiggy.

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: My boyfriend lives in Chelsea. I was with him all night. And Will didn’t hustle me. He cheated me. After gaming that Cujo bet me double or nothing and then cleared the table with a single shot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: It was like that cue ball was possessed or something.

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: No one is that good or that lucky, so yeah, I got pissed. But I didn’t kill the guy. In fact, Will tracked me down the next day and offered to give the money back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He was just going to pay you back twenty thousand dollars, what, out of the kindness of his heart?

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: In exchange for some knowledge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s some expensive knowledge. What did you do for him?

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: I didn’t do anything. We just talked.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So what did Will want to know?

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: He wanted me to case a brownstone on the Upper East Side.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That sounds like more than talking.

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: I don’t do that stuff anymore. Will just asked how he could break in himself.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why? What was so special about that brownstone?

utterance.speaker: JIGGY
utterance.content: I don’t know, but it wasn’t going to be easy. Place had the works. Motion detectors, motion and thermal sensors. You’d have to be nuts to try to go in there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What do you say that we … forget … that you were acting like a Wikipedia of B and E’s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you give us the address of that brownstone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There was a break-in at 39 East 70th Street earlier this week. And the owner, Tom Talmadge, was assaulted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tom Talmadge? He is the founder of that ride share service, Hytch.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What, the stupid cars with the thumbs on the roof?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Laugh all you want. That app made him a billionaire.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s Will doing breaking into a billionaire’s house?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but here’s the weird thing. Tom was hospitalized. And he refused to give a description of the attacker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It can’t be a coincidence that Will shows up dead a few days later.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. He’s hiding something.

utterance.speaker: TOM TALMADGE
utterance.content: I already told the other cops. I don’t want to give a statement.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Talmadge, what’s your relationship to William Fairwick?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I don’t know who that is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Talmadge, your reaction says otherwise. Was he your attacker?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I’m not giving a statement.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Given that Mr. Fairwick was murdered, you might want to rethink that.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Murdered?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Look, if you’re implying that I had something to do with it –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, why else would you refuse to answer the question?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Because you won’t believe me anyway. It’ll sound crazy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You wouldn’t believe the crazy things we’ve heard. Try us.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I’d gotten home early, cracked a beer. But before I could settle in I had this feeling, like I was being watched. Then, out of nowhere, something threw me to the ground.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, something? You mean him, right?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: No. I mean something. Some force. I could feel it on top of me, suffocating me. But there was nothing there. I must have blacked out for a second. When I came to, that guy was standing over me, screaming, “Stop it, you’re killing him, this wasn’t the deal.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who was he yelling at?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I don’t know. There wasn’t anyone else there. But I think that guy saved my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This … force. What did it want?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: It just … seemed like it wanted me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine. I admit, it is weird. But I can tell you this: whatever Talmadge saw or didn’t see, it wasn’t the devil.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re right. It’s probably one of his minions. A lowly demon that wills someone from Beelzebub to help him get whatever it is he wanted from Talmadge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Demons don’t need help getting past security systems and the devil doesn’t need to use the door.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to take another look at that security cam footage from Will’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where’s the DVD?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: What DVD?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I put a DVD of security footage in this evidence box. Where is it?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: If it ain’t in there you didn’t put it in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hell I didn’t. Who’s been in here in the past two hours?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER
utterance.content: Detective, no one’s been in or out of this room since you checked that box in this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’d it do? Just walk out on its own?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it didn’t just walk out on its own. Beckett, you were right. The killer isn’t the devil. The devil doesn’t need to dispose of evidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clearly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Clearly is the perfect word, because clearly our killer is the invisible man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You collapsed the foam.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I called Will’s place to pull security cam footage from the hallway again. And all the files have been erased. The doorman swears that no one has been in the security room since NYPD left the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one or someone he couldn’t see? Beckett, it fits all the facts. The attack on Talmadge by an unseen force, the missing evidence, the haunted cue ball, even Will’s murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, stop. There is no such thing as the invisible man. But something is going on and Will is at the center of it. Hey, Espo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What else have we found on Will Fairwick?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, Ryan’s still trying to get in touch with his employer, Greenblatt Insurance, and Tory’s still trying to crack his electronics. Apparently Will had some heavy encryption on his hardware.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That seems a little unnecessary for someone in the insurance industry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but I just got his phone records from his wireless carrier, and dude didn’t talk much except to this number right here. He traded dozens of calls with it over the last six weeks. And he didn’t ever call it before then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It looks like they spoke nearly every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who owns that number?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s registered to a Ms. Donna Brooks. Says here she’s a marine biology professor at Hudson U.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s he doing talking to a biology professor?

utterance.speaker: DONNA BROOKS
utterance.content: I haven’t heard from him in a few days. I – I was worried, but I never imagined this. I can’t believe he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Donna, I know this is hard, but how do you know Will?

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: Um… I guess you could say we were dating. He reached out on Facebook a couple months ago. I hadn’t seen him since we first dated back at MIT.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An anarchist pool shark attended MIT?

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: He was always a rebel. And the smartest student in our class.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did he get back in touch?

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: Will dropped out after only a semester, so he wanted to talk about finishing his degree, enrolling here at Hudson. It was crazy. Even after all that time, the spark was still there between us.

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: Excuse me. Cuttlefish don’t like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he ever mention the name Tom Talmadge?

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: Uh … no. Not that I remember.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was there anything out of the ordinary going on in Will’s life?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like way, way, way out of the ordinary.

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: Yeah … there was. Will started acting paranoid last week. We went to dinner and he would only take a table facing the door. He said he thought he was being watched.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By who?

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: He would only say “by them”. I thought he was imagining it. I told him he needed to get help so that it didn’t become MIT all over again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE

utterance.speaker: RYAN

utterance.speaker: BECKETT

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is - this is real! This is –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE

utterance.content: Actually, we –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All right. Um … keep me posted.

utterance.content: Do you hear that?

utterance.content: Very funny, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Just hear the music.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.content: Is that your hand on my leg?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … yeah. Yeah, pretty sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.content: I just – I feel like we’re being watched.

utterance.content: Pretty sure we’re not being watched.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Maybe this isn’t such a good idea.

utterance.content: And you thought zombie apocalypse survival camp was a waste of time.

utterance.content: Good. Okay.

utterance.content: What?

utterance.content: You just kind of make nerdy … sexy.

utterance.content: That’s true. Where were we?

utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.content: Mother?

utterance.content: Martha?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh my lord. Well …

utterance.content: So CSU reprocessed that crime scene. No new fingerprints, which means –

utterance.content: Come on, an invisible man?

utterance.content: I’m just saying. Even Beckett seemed freaked out last night.

utterance.content: It would be cool, the power of invisibility.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I would so sneak into Area 51. You?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Super Bowl. Fifty yard line. Best seat in the house.

utterance.content: Hey, what’s that on your neck?

utterance.content: Is that … body glitter? Is that a scratch?

utterance.content: Oh come – ugh.

utterance.content: What?

utterance.content: Men-hattan.

utterance.content: Men-hattan. You got a job protecting male strippers?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. It’s no joke. It’s more dangerous than this job. Those women, they rush the stage like these are the last men on the planet. I have bruises I can’t explain. Ladies be crazy, Javi.

utterance.content: The card’s RFID architecture is like nothing I’ve ever seen.

utterance.content: Yeah. It was the only way I could get Advantus Apparel to share their client list with us. Now, they said that they shipped the Greenblatt order to this office four years ago.

utterance.content: Let me get someone to assist you.

utterance.speaker: AGENT

utterance.speaker: SARKOV
utterance.content: Cover story to avoid questions.

utterance.content: Quantum engineering? DARPA? You are researching invisibility.

utterance.content: Cloaking, however, is science.

utterance.speaker: SARKOV
utterance.content: I have answered your questions, now answer mine. How did you find out about our technology?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: During our investigation we encountered … an unseen person –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Invisible person.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - at Will’s apartment. We believe this – whoever was behind his murder. Given the research you’re doing here, we believe the killer is connected to this facility.

utterance.speaker: SARKOV
utterance.content: It’s impossible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know what we saw.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or didn’t see.

utterance.content: No, it’s impossible because we haven’t gotten our technology to work. But I think I know who did.

utterance.content: The Chinese?

utterance.content: They’ve been pursuing the same technology. We heard they were close to a breakthrough.

utterance.content: Why would you suspect them?

utterance.content: Because a few days ago we suffered a crippling cyber-attack. All of our data was wiped out. Our team managed to trace the virus to a relay station in Shanghai.

utterance.content: Castle, if the Chinese are behind this, why would they try to stop us from taking Will’s keycard and what do they have to do with Talmadge?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT

utterance.content: Unis went to Henry Wright’s apartment and found it cleaned out. Closet, dresser, empty. Dude’s gone.

utterance.content: What have we found on him?

utterance.content: And he had another connection to this case. Henry attended Cal Tech with – wait for it – assault victim Tom Talmadge. They were roommates. And this is the lawsuit that Henry filed against Talmadge accusing him of stealing the code that he used to build Hytch. The court dismissed the case.

utterance.content: Costing Henry billions. Sarkov said her lab hadn’t cracked the cloaking technology, but what if Will did, with a little help from his neighbor, Henry? And with a functioning suit, Henry could’ve enlisted Will’s help to get revenge against Talmadge.

utterance.content: Okay. How do we find this kid?

utterance.content: Look, we know that you went after Tom Talmadge. You were behind a cyber-attack that brought down a government lab. And then you cleaned out your apartment and you disappeared.

utterance.speaker: HENRY
utterance.content: Because I was afraid they would come after me next.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.content: The same people who killed Will. All right? If they found out that I knew –

utterance.content: Yeah well, his broken ribs say otherwise.

utterance.content: You got angry with Will for stopping you. So you decided to use the suit to kill him instead, right?

utterance.content: No! We both realized that I had become Frodo. And the suit was the One Ring to rule them all. Will knew it was too much power for anyone to have, especially the government.

utterance.content: So that was Will’s Oppenheimer moment. The suit became the atomic bomb.

utterance.content: And right after Will was murdered, she stops calling. Almost as if she knew he was dead.

utterance.content: Wait, you think I had something to do with Will’s death?

utterance.content: Donna, you missed your class the night that he was killed. Where were you?

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: At home. With a cold. I never would have hurt Will. I loved him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You loved him, but then he betrayed you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That must’ve made you angry. To find out that he was just using you for your research.

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: That’s not true.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was the second time that he left you and you couldn’t live with the embarrassment.

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. I’m not going to stand here and let you accuse me of killing my boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Donna, that was you in the suit in the apartment with us. It was the same suit that you used to kill Will. You found out about his project. And before he could destroy it, you used his own creation against him.

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: What suit? What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The suit you wore when you went after Will’s keycard and you got my credit card instead. Just found it, buried in the back of your drawer. Thank you for that, by the way. I forgot to cancel this thing. It would be such a pain.

utterance.speaker: DONNA
utterance.content: What was I supposed to do? Let him get away with it? He stopped calling. Stopped texting. He used me. And then pretended like I didn’t exist. He wanted me to just disappear from his life. So I did. And he never saw me coming.

utterance.content: Okay, okay.

utterance.content: Her backpack and clothes. She’s wearing the suit.

utterance.content: Castle, block the door.

utterance.content: Right. She is not slipping past this time.

utterance.content: Donna, there’s nowhere to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah ha… got you now. I so miss these mind melds.

utterance.content: Beckett, what would you do if you were invisible?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’d walk out of here without having to file this report.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm. Boring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about you, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Be a fly on the wall, see what Beckett’s dad really thinks of me.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm. What’s this? "Time you had a proper uniform. Love, Javi."

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s from the heart, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Too big?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Want to help me try it on?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They told me it was new.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I could really use your help.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Get that away from me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What? Blue’s my color. What’s wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, enough!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just help me try it on. You don’t have to be embarrassed.

utterance.speaker: SARKOV
utterance.content: We’ll be taking custody of that, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Will thought this was too much power for any one person to have, and with everything that’s happened, I think I agree. This kind of science is a bit of a deal with the devil. Be careful not to lose your soul.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother is out for the evening. Alexis is pulling an all-nighter at the library.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we’re actually, truly, really alone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This came in this morning. Switching to thermal. Scanning the room. The room is clear. All except for the very hot object before me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Give me a minute and let me slip into something special, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. If it’s the something special I got you for Valentine’s Day, I approve.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s even better. It’s invisible.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
